actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1435 (Part I).
Referred to House Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to House from the Committee on Appropriations with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1435 (Part II).
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure failed of passage in House under suspension of rules, roll call #760 (244-141).

official_title: A bill to amend section 1402 (a) of title 10, United States Code, to revise the rule for computation of retired or retainer pay to reflect later active duty.

summary.as: Reported to House amended, Part I
summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1435 (Part I)) Revises the method of computing military retired pay by permitting persons recalled to active duty after October 1, 1963, who were released from active duty before October 1, 1976, after having served continuously on active duty for at least two years, to use the rates of basic pay in effect at the time of that release from active duty in recomputing their retired pay. Provides that no person will receive less retired or retained pay because of the enactment of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1402 (a) of title 10, United States Code, to revise the rule for computation of retired or retainer pay to reflect later active duty.
